INDIRECT_ADDRESSING_REGISTER_0.description: Indirect addressing register 0, not physically implemented. Accesses RAM pointed to by MP0.

MP0.description: Memory Pointer Register 0, used to access RAM indirectly via the Indirect addressing register 0.

INDIRECT_ADDRESSING_REGISTER_1.description: Indirect addressing register 1, not physically implemented. Accesses RAM pointed to by MP1.

MP1.description: Memory Pointer Register 1, used to access RAM indirectly via the Indirect addressing register 1 and for bank selection.

BP.description: Bank Pointer, selects the active RAM bank (Bank 0, Bank 1, or Bank 2) for indirect addressing via MP1.

ACC.description: Accumulator, the primary register for arithmetic and logic unit (ALU) operations and data movement.

PCL.description: Program Counter Lower-order Byte register. Modifying this register performs a short jump within 256 locations.

TBLP.description: Table Pointer, specifies the address within program memory for look-up table read operations.

TBLH.description: Table Higher-order Byte Register. Stores the higher-order byte of data read from a look-up table in program memory. Read-only.

STATUS.description: Status register, contains flags indicating the results of operations and system status (Carry, Auxiliary Carry, Zero, Overflow, Power Down Flag, Watchdog Time-Out).

INTC0.description: Interrupt Control Register 0, controls the master (global) interrupt, external interrupt, and Timer/Event Counter 0/1 interrupts, and holds their respective request flags.

TMR0H.description: Timer/Event Counter 0 Higher-order Byte register. Forms the upper 8 bits of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 0.

TMR0L.description: Timer/Event Counter 0 Lower-order Byte register. Forms the lower 8 bits of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 0.

TMR0C.description: Timer/Event Counter 0 Control Register, defines its operating mode (event count, timer, pulse width measurement), prescaler settings, and active edge for external input.

TMR1H.description: Timer/Event Counter 1 Higher-order Byte register. Forms the upper 8 bits of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 1.

TMR1L.description: Timer/Event Counter 1 Lower-order Byte register. Forms the lower 8 bits of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 1.

TMR1C.description: Timer/Event Counter 1 Control Register, defines its operating mode (event count, timer, pulse width measurement), and active edge for external input.

PA.description: Port A data register, providing bidirectional 8-bit input/output for pins PA0-PA7.

PAC.description: Port A control register, configures PA lines as CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input with/without pull-high resistor.

PB.description: Port B data register, providing bidirectional 8-bit input/output for pins PB0-PB7, also configurable as A/D inputs.

PBC.description: Port B control register, configures PB lines as CMOS output, Schmitt trigger input with/without pull-high resistor, or A/D input.

PC.description: Port C data register, providing bidirectional 8-bit input/output for pins PC0-PC7 (PC0-PC4 for 28-pin package).

PCC.description: Port C control register, configures PC lines as CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input with/without pull-high resistor.

PD.description: Port D data register, providing bidirectional 8-bit input/output for pins PD0-PD7, also configurable for PWM output.

PDC.description: Port D control register, configures PD lines as CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input with/without pull-high resistor, and enables PWM output function.

PWM0.description: PWM data register for channel 0, used to set the duty cycle of the PWM0 output.

PWM1.description: PWM data register for channel 1, used to set the duty cycle of the PWM1 output.

PWM2.description: PWM data register for channel 2, used to set the duty cycle of the PWM2 output.

PWM3.description: PWM data register for channel 3, used to set the duty cycle of the PWM3 output.

INTC1.description: Interrupt Control Register 1, controls A/D converter and I2C Bus interrupts, and holds their respective request flags.

HADR.description: I2C Bus Slave Address Register, defines the 7-bit slave address for the device's I2C communication.

HCR.description: I2C Bus Control Register, configures I2C Bus function enable/disable, transmit/receive mode, and transmit acknowledge signal behavior.

HSR.description: I2C Bus Status Register, indicates various I2C Bus statuses such as data transfer completion, address match, bus busy, and read/write command.

HDR.description: I2C Bus Data Register, used for transmitting and receiving data bytes over the I2C Bus.

ADRL.description: A/D Result Lower-order Byte Register, stores the lower 2 bits (D1-D0) of the 10-bit A/D conversion result. Read-only.

ADRH.description: A/D Result Higher-order Byte Register, stores the higher 8 bits (D9-D2) of the 10-bit A/D conversion result. Read-only.

ADCR.description: A/D Control Register, defines the analog input channel, configures Port B pins for A/D input, controls starting A/D conversion, and indicates end of conversion.

ACSR.description: A/D Clock Setting Register, selects the clock source for the A/D converter.

PF.description: Port F data register, providing bidirectional 8-bit input/output for pins PF0-PF7 (48-pin package only).

PFC.description: Port F control register, configures PF lines as CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input with/without pull-high resistor.
